gobblin.util

Class ParallelRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.util.ParallelRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class ParallelRunner
extends Object
implements Closeable
    A class that is responsible for running certain methods in parallel. Methods in this class returns immediately and are run in a fixed-size thread pool.

    This class is intended to be used in the following pattern. This example uses the serialize() method. 

     
     Closer closer = Closer.create();
     try {
       // Do stuff
       ParallelRunner runner = closer.register(new ParallelRunner(threads, fs));
       runner.serialize(state1, outputFilePath1);
       // Submit more serialization tasks
       runner.serialize(stateN, outputFilePathN);
       // Do stuff
     } catch (Throwable e) {
       throw closer.rethrow(e);
     } finally {
       closer.close();
     }
    Note that calling close() will wait for all submitted tasks to complete and then stop the ParallelRunner by shutting down the ExecutorService.

    • Method Detail

      • serializeToFile

        public <T extends State> void serializeToFile(T state,
                                              Path outputFilePath)
        Serialize a State object into a file.

        This method submits a task to serialize the State object and returns immediately after the task is submitted.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the State object type
        Parameters:
        state - the State object to be serialized
        outputFilePath - the file to write the serialized State object to

      • deserializeFromFile

        public <T extends State> void deserializeFromFile(T state,
                                                  Path inputFilePath)
        Deserialize a State object from a file.

        This method submits a task to deserialize the State object and returns immediately after the task is submitted.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the State object type
        Parameters:
        state - an empty State object to which the deserialized content will be populated
        inputFilePath - the input file to read from

      • deserializeFromSequenceFile

        public <T extends State> void deserializeFromSequenceFile(Class<? extends Writable> keyClass,
                                                          Class<T> stateClass,
                                                          Path inputFilePath,
                                                          Collection<T> states,
                                                          boolean deleteAfter)
        Deserialize a list of State objects from a Hadoop SequenceFile.

        This method submits a task to deserialize the State objects and returns immediately after the task is submitted.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the State object type
        Parameters:
        stateClass - the Class object of the State class
        inputFilePath - the input SequenceFile to read from
        states - a Collection object to store the deserialized State objects
        deleteAfter - a flag telling whether to delete the SequenceFile afterwards
